scenarioDescription:
The HD 154672 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 154672 is a star with 1.18 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.32 times its radius. It is located 205.64 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 154672 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 154672 system


HD 154672 b

HD 154672 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2008-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 154672 b is 1707.660 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 154672 b is 12.800 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 154672 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 154672, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 154672 - System With 1 Exoplanet
